def: A small marline spike having generally a wooden handle, -- usedin sailmaking. R. H. Dana, Ir.
Pertaining to derived from, or designating, an acid, H2B4O7(called also tetraboric acid), which is the acid ingredient ofordinary borax, and is obtained by heating boric acid.
A smooth drift. See Drift, n., 9.
imperative sing. of L. videre, to see; -- used to directattention to something; as, vide supra, see above.
The more ancient of the two great epic poems in Sanskrit. Thehero and heroine are Rama and his wife Sita.
One who takes or receives; one who catches or apprehended.
A rope applied to the fore yardarm, to change the position ofthe foresail.
Pertaining or according to a nomenclature.
